gospel.text:
[[Mc 1,14]]After John had been arrested, Jesus came to Galilee proclaiming the Gospel of God:
[[Mc 1,15]]"This is the time of fulfillment. The kingdom of God is at hand. Repent, and believe in the gospel."
[[Mc 1,16]]As he passed by the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting their nets into the sea; they were fishermen.
[[Mc 1,17]]Jesus said to them, "Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men."
[[Mc 1,18]]Then they abandoned their nets and followed him.
[[Mc 1,19]]He walked along a little farther and saw James, the son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They too were in a boat mending their nets.
[[Mc 1,20]]Then he called them. So they left their father Zebedee in the boat along with the hired men and followed him.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

second_reading.text:
[[1_Co 7,29]]I tell you, brothers and sisters, the time is running out. From now on, let those having wives act as not having them,
[[1_Co 7,30]]those weeping as not weeping, those rejoicing as not rejoicing, those buying as not owning,
[[1_Co 7,31]]those using the world as not using it fully. For the world in its present form is passing away.
second_reading.title: First Letter to the Corinthians

first_reading.text:
[[Jon 3,1]]The word of the LORD came to Jonah a second time:
[[Jon 3,2]]"Set out for the great city of Nineveh, and announce to it the message that I will tell you."
[[Jon 3,3]]So Jonah made ready and went to Nineveh, according to the LORD'S bidding. Now Nineveh was an enormously large city; it took three days to go through it.
[[Jon 3,4]]Jonah began his journey through the city, and had gone but a single day's walk announcing, "Forty days more and Nineveh shall be destroyed,"
[[Jon 3,5]]when the people of Nineveh believed God; they proclaimed a fast and all of them, great and small, put on sackcloth.
[[Jon 3,10]]When God saw by their actions how they turned from their evil way, he repented of the evil that he had threatened to do to them; he did not carry it out.
first_reading.title: Book of Jonah

psalm.text:
[[Ps 25,4b]]Your ways, O LORD, make known to me;
[[Ps 25,4c]]teach me your paths,
[[Ps 25,5a]]guide me in your truth and teach me,
[[Ps 25,5b]]for you are God my savior.

[[Ps 25,6]]Remember that your compassion, O LORD, 
and your love are from of old.
[[Ps 25,7b]]In your kindness remember me,
[[Ps 25,7c]]because of your goodness, O LORD.

[[Ps 25,8]]Good and upright is the LORD; 
thus he shows sinners the way.
[[Ps 25,9]]He guides the humble to justice, 
he teaches the humble his way.
psalm.title: Psalms
